title:
Sparse and Dense Data with CNNs: Depth Completion and Semantic
  Segmentation
author: Maximilian Jaritz
Raoul de Charette
Emilie Wirbel
Xavier Perrotton
Fawzi Nashashibi
abstract:
Convolutional neural networks are designed for dense data, but vision data is
often sparse (stereo depth, point clouds, pen stroke, etc.). We present a
method to handle sparse depth data with optional dense RGB, and accomplish
depth completion and semantic segmentation changing only the last layer. Our
proposal efficiently learns sparse features without the need of an additional
validity mask. We show how to ensure network robustness to varying input
sparsities. Our method even works with densities as low as 0.8% (8 layer
lidar), and outperforms all published state-of-the-art on the Kitti depth
completion benchmark.
